content: On August 4, 1993, the Atlanta Braves played a pivotal game against the San Francisco Giants, resulting in a thrilling 4-3 victory. This game was notable for a dramatic eighth-inning comeback, highlighted by a clutch two-run double from David Justice. The win helped the Braves maintain their lead in the National League East, ultimately leading them to the division title that season and setting the stage for their run in the postseason.
